creator.name: Evangelisch-Lutherse gemeente te Amsterdam
creator.his_func: As a result of its synodal activities, the Evangelical-Lutheran congregation of Amsterdam became actively involved with the Lutheran churches overseas. During the first half of the 18th century requests for the support of the establishment of Lutheran congregations in Berbice, Suriname, and Curaçao were received and eventually honored. Similar requests from St Eustatius, Demerara and Essequibo were turned down. The congregation of Amsterdam exercised extensive influence over the churches in the colonies and also appointed the ministers.
creator.Aantekeningen: P.A. Christiaans, Evangelisch-Luthers doopregister Paramaribo 1743-1809, Den Haag 1996
